subject: Re: [junit] Testing EJB's
msgSnippet: ... If you have a Local interface, yes. If there is no remote interface at all, then I don t know how you would code /any/ client for that EJB, and a Unit Test
messageBody:
Cristiane Frota wrote:

> Hello,
>
> I'm using CMP EJB's.
> Can I do a unitary test to a class that there isn't a remote
> interface?

If you have a Local interface, yes. If there is no remote interface at
all, then I don't know how you would code /any/ client for that EJB, and
a Unit Test is just another client.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services

Let's write software that people understand
